Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery pelike; interior glazed streaky black; exterior: from top, bottom of bud ornament; red-figure decoration consisting of head and shoulders of bearded man to right, with himation over left shoulder; dilute brown for lips, curls on forehead and at back of neck, and ends of beard.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (E436.2)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 438, no. C2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0105) (Phase 1)
